website_summaries.verdict: This plush pillow helps support your baby's head and neck for the first full year of his or her life.
pros: Provides head support for infants up to 6 months and then converts to neck support for infants up to 1 year old
Some users say it helped eliminate flat spots on their child's head
cons: Some babies do not like how thick this pillow is and cannot sleep comfortably on it

customer_reviews.title: It really works! And Fast!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is amazing! After one night of use I noticed a big difference. My baby had a flat spot in the middle portion of the back of his head and also the top part seemed "tall" I felt it was going to only get worse and the entire back of his head would be flat. Here is a before and after picture of using the pillow for only FIVE days! His head gets rounder and rounder everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Zadoyan

customer_reviews.title: Works!!!
customer_reviews.text: At my daughters 4 month check up her doctor said she needed a helmet because of her flat head. After reading many reviews of people fixing flat heads themselves I decided to buy this pillow. We have been using this pillow for a month and 3 weeks now and her head is almost completely rounded out!!
customer_reviews.author: Juan Uribe

customer_reviews.title: my baby had really bad flat spots on right side of his head
customer_reviews.text: This pillow really works, my baby had really bad flat spots on right side of his head, i was afraid he was going to need a helmet, i ordered three different pillows and none of them worked, and then my mom told me to order the "donut" shaped one instead of foamie pillow, and i ordered this, so glad i did, my little guy's head is so perfect, even i cannot believe how much it has improved. So do not hesitate, I'd recomend it to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it works!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow actually worked! Our baby was getting a flat spot on the back of his head, so we started using this pillow whenever we laid him down(during the day, not when he was asleep). A month later the flat spot was gone, and we won't be needing a helmet. I recommend this to anyone. I should add that our baby was about 3.5 months old when we started using the pillow. We used it for <2 months total, basically until he started moving around too much for it to be useful.

customer_reviews.author: Brittany Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Helped with flat head

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

I recognize that this usually works itself out. That being the case, my wife and I were glad to have purchased the item.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Morgan

customer_reviews.title: My baby boys head improved!

I wa a worried about my son having a flat head at 2 months so I have been using the pillow nonstop, every change, every nap time jus whenever and it certainly shaped out. Gradually, nothing dramatic but even my family noticed it. It do exactly what it say great product. I will post a picture when I feel I’ve reached peak usage
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: SUPER PLEASED!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I purchased this pillow to help my infants head. It had become very flat and more on one side, due to him sleeping for 12 hours on his back each night. It's been about 3 weeks or so and we see a HUGE difference. It corrected the one sided flatness and his head is now barely flat at all. We use it anytime he's on his back, except for the car seat because it won't fit. If you're a nervous momma and want to avoid a helmet, get this pillow!!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Ehrett

customer_reviews.title: I didn’t notice any drastic before and afters like some of the other reviews did
customer_reviews.text: I’ll be honest here, I didn’t notice any drastic before and afters like some of the other reviews did, but I purchased this item right when my baby started to roll, so he’s dodged this. The concept is great, just wished it wasn’t so expensive, and B), that the Velcro part wasn’t right where the neck area is, as the overlapping of the two arms creates such a raised height it seems uncomfortable for my son. He definitely doesn’t like this pillow. As for the people who said that once they’ve washed it it got all lumpy, that didn’t happen with mine because I followed directions according to the tag. No issues with that.
customer_reviews.author: Banana nana

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for babies with flat spot on the back of their head rather than he side...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who has a pretty clear flat spot on the right back of his head. It is soft and he doesn't seem to mind laying on it, but I don't think it allows pressure on the other side to correct the flat spot. I think this would be good for a baby who is developing a flat spot directly on the back of their head, but not on the side.
customer_reviews.author: dcdawg

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: At my son's 2nd month checkup, his pediatrician said my son has a flat spot on the right side and back of his head, so I have to keep turning my son's head when sleeping or anytime he is laying flat. I saw so many head shaping pillows and decided on this one because it can also be used as a neck pillow. I used this all the time even during diaper change, sleeping, breasfeeding. It's so soft and my son sleeps well. Today was my son's 4 month check up and yay! He said my son's head looks really good now, round and symmetrical and to keep it up!
customer_reviews.author: Z1Z2

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw?
customer_reviews.text: The product is very soft but does not really work for a pillow unless your baby is older and doesn’t need it adjusted. The pillow comes with a Velcro circle so you can adjust the ends of the pillow to make it smaller or larger for your baby’s head to fit but realistically it doesn’t serve the purpose. If you adjust the pillow to make it smaller then you have a lopsided pillow and the baby’s head isn’t stable. I wish it worked bc it’s very soft but it’s a large lump with one side higher than the other under my baby’s neck just wasn’t conducive to her sleeping well. Maybe it works better for older kids?
customer_reviews.author: Austin Zobec

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Works. i was so worried about my sons head shape , it was getting so flat from the back since he likes sleeping head flat up. My oldest son also had a flat head and we got the 3k helmet and it round it out but as soon as he stopped using it he's head got back to flat!! He's 4 now and his head is pretty flat:( .. so I bought this for my baby in hopes of preventing the helmet. I love it! I wish I would of heard about it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: eunice machado

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend

Thankfully my baby started using this "pillow" before he learned how to roll over and it worked really well. I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa D.

customer_reviews.title: Useful and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on a blog review I read. My 3 month old had a head that was a little flat on one side. I love that this pillow can velcro together around his neck or it can be used open and the velcro can be covered with the flap. I have used this when he fell asleep in the high chair as well. Of course I kept my eye on him so he did not fall asleep on his face. My husband even said that this is the cutest and smallest neck pillow he has ever seen!
customer_reviews.author: Kayleigh Mihalko

customer_reviews.title: Great little support pillow for plagiocephaly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as my baby has plagiocephaly also known as flat head. I use it all the time and while he still has a flat head and is headed towards wearing a helmet, this pillow has definitely helped round out his head in just a month. You should know that my baby has moderate to severe plagiocephaly in the left side of his head, most likely from lack of space in utero, so if it were minor, it might do the trick. It is soft and supportive and does the job perfectly. My mom who watches my baby even got one of a different color and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Giroult

customer_reviews.title: Every mamas essential
customer_reviews.text: Used this for my son at 3 month until 15 months. This is probably the number one reason why his mishead shape came back to normal. Saved him from worsening his head shape. Remember, this item is not made for babies to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: At 2 months my child was evaluated and told she had tortecollis and flat head syndrome. We sought advice from a pediatrician, PT, and chiropractor. None of them mentioned this pillow. After doing my own research I found other moms saying that this pillow was super helpful. After three week of using this pillow during naps and when she's on the ground at home, her head started to round out. Went back to the PT and her head shape measurements had totally changed. Amazing! If you have a child with a flat head I would highly recommend this pillow! This pillow may have saved us thousands of dollars, by avoiding a helmet!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Left before, right after only 1 week of using this pillow. Son was born breeched and had torticollis and noticeable plagiocephaly at week 3. Did extra tummy time and exercises for a few weeks. At week 7 i saw some improvement but noticed he was getting another flat spot on the back of his head, likely from his carseat. I bought this pillow for sleeping and his swings. Have noticed a difference. also got the boppy flat head pillow for his carseat. In conjunction of both products, I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wiest

customer_reviews.title: Not safe

Another thing I noticed a day after using it is that there are a ton of tiny clear micro fibers coming out of it which can easy get into baby’s eyes or mouth. I don’t think this is a safe product to use for babies. I ended up just using the babymoov lovenest pillow I had, much better quality and kept his head shape round. I wanted an extra pillow for my baby to have at grandmas and thought this one would be good but it was a bit let down.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Great support pillow!

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend

My newest son also has tort but this time I started using the pillow as soon as I noticed flatness (2 months) he’s been using it for THREE DAYS & (the photo posted) this is the result! Definitely going to keep using it. I’m hoping to avoid a helmet this time around but I definitely recommend this pillow. We are VERY consistent. Anytime he’s on his back he’s in the pillow.

product_meta.title: Babymoon Pod - for Flat Head Syndrome & Neck Support (Aqua Dot)
feature_bullets: Babymoon Pod is one of the most prescribed baby flat head pillows as therapy in addressing positional plagiocephaly or flat head syndrome ~ not just by professionals but by Moms too!
Multi-purpose baby pillow can be used laying down on changing pad, playtime, in the bouncer and swing, stroller & car seat, while nursing.

Head Support from birth to 6 months; Then use for Neck Support from 6+ months 100% Cotton Cover / 100% Polyester Filling / Dimensions: 10" x 10" x 2.5" / Machine Wash and Dry /Adjustable / Made in the USA

HEAD SUPPORT: The two arms can be attached to make a head support by overlapping the ends of the right arm (Velcro arm) and the left arm. The Velcro on the right arm sticks to the white portion on the left arm to create a secure attachment which prevents the head from falling through the opening. The circular opening of the pod cradles the back of the head while providing comfortable placement and optimal positioning. The length of the white portion allows the pod to be adjusted to various siz

NECK SUPPORT: Once the two arms are detached, the Velcro should be covered with the Peek-a-Boo cover located on the upper side of the right arm. The Peek-a-Boo cover is the self-fabric flap, which should be turned inside out to hide the Velcro in order to avoid irritation to the skin.
